From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To display an idle terminal message, use the **vacant-message** command in line configuration mode. To remove the default vacant message or any other vacant message that may have been set, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: (Optional) Delimiting character that marks the beginning and end of the vacant-message. Text delimiters are characters that do not ordinarily appear within the text of a title, such as slash ( / ), double quote ("), or tildeÂ (~). ^C is reserved for special use and should not be used in the message.

Examples: The following example turns on the system banner and displays this <message>:
ExtraInfo: This command enables the banner to be displayed on the screen of an idle terminal. The **vacant-message** command without any arguments restores the default message.Follow this command with one or more blank spaces and a delimiting character of your choice. Then enter one or more lines of text, terminating the message with the second occurrence of the delimiting character.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/note.gif)---**Note** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)For a rotary group, you need to define only the message for the first line in the group.---
